meanings.definition: To put (a dead body) in the ground or a tomb.
meanings.sent1: The family was burying their beloved pet in the backyard.
meanings.sent2: The funeral procession was burying the deceased in the cemetery.
meanings.sent3: The children were burying their treasure in the sandbox, pretending to be pirates.
meanings.sent4: The snow was burying the town under a thick white blanket, making everything quiet.
meanings.sent5: The gardener was burying the seeds in the soil, hoping for a bountiful harvest.

meanings.sent1: The cat was burying its toy under the rug, trying to hide it.
meanings.sent2: The landslide was burying the road, making it impassable.
meanings.sent3: The chef was burying the burnt toast under a mountain of fresh slices.
meanings.sent4: The sandstorm was burying the ancient ruins, preserving them for centuries.
meanings.sent5: The avalanche was burying the skiers, causing a frantic rescue operation.

meanings.sent1: The squirrel was burying its acorns in the forest floor for winter.
meanings.sent2: The pirate was burying his treasure chest on the deserted island.
meanings.sent3: The magician was burying the coin under the handkerchief, ready to surprise the audience.
meanings.sent4: The time capsule was burying memories for future generations to discover.
meanings.sent5: The archaeologist was burying the artifact in a protective layer of sand, preserving it for study.
